授業目的: This course is a continuation of Language and Culture in Japan A.  The main objective of this seminar is to gain a deeper understanding of the topics covered in Language and Culture A.  Emphasis is placed on having students analyze the Japanese language data and investigate how the concept of “self”, uti-soto (in-group and out-group), or empathy, for example, is encoded in the language.  Youth language and Osaka-dialect are also discussed.
到達目標:
To understand some of the important characteristics of the Japanese language.
To understand how language and society are related using linguistic data from the Japanese language.
To be able to present what students learned in the assigned readings.
To be able to work on a project and do the presentations.
特記事項: 【合併】総合日本学習科目（言語と文化Ｂ）（CIEC）/Language and Culture in Japan B（国際学部）
授業方法: Seminar style course. There will be lectures, discussions, individual paper presentations, and group projects. Japanese students and foreign students are expected to work together in group on a topic of interest and do the presentation at the end of the course.

第2回: Some characteristics of the Japanese language
第3回: Japanese kinship terms and concept of “self”.
第8回: More on uchi/soto and keigo in Japanese
第10回: The world of onomatopoeia in Japanese
第13回: Preparation for the presentations of the Projects
トピック.授業外学習2: The students are expected to spend about 3 hours for their assignments outsides class, e.g., reading assignments, writing assignments, and group work (discussion, preparing for their presentations).

成績評価Grading0: 評価基準等　Grading Criteria etc.
成績評価Grading2: Participation (by doing reading and writing assignments), a presentations of the assigned article, and a student's presentation of his/her project
